info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shippingport, or 7 miles east of East Liverpool, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Robinson Township, Economy, Ambridge, Coraopolis, Baden, Sewickley, Ohioville, Harmony Township, and Midland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 65 and 71. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 41 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
